item.title: Steps of One Simple CRUD
item.description: This article is based on John Smilga’s JS project Grocery Bud. I summarize these steps to keep a reference of how to write full CRUD for my later study. Select all the needed elements (including get some pseudo ID) Start working on submitting form:(this eventListener callback function is written somewhere else, like, all the functions are written together so that we can manage the code more clearly.) Three conditions: What if we have value and the action is not edit What if we have value and the action is edit What if we don’t provide any value?

item.title: How to make dynamic navbar?
item.description: This article is based on the Scroll project here. Intro In CSS, the conainer height is set to 0 dy default, because we don’t wanna show the container when we first load the page. We want to use the toggle button to control whether to show it or not. That’s also how we use toggle method. In CSS, we set the style of class .show-links to be height of 200, so when we add this class by using event listener, we will see the links.

item.title: How to build dynamic HTML elements with vanilla JS?
item.description: Here is the summary of some tricks from John Smilga’s JS projects. This post is depending on ‘Menu’. INTRO: While building simple project, it seems ok to hard-code some elements, like the buttons here. But in the real world, it would be better to dynamically render buttons due to the data we fetched from some database. Use vanilla JS to load content when the DOM was first rendered.
